1
DAZ: Oeno, I saw your scroll today regarding the issues you and Coleus encountered during the <color=orange>Sanctuary's</color> construction. (My thanks to both of you for your help testing the voyager stones!)
2 1
DAZ: To your first observation: what you described is indeed an intended feature! The memory storage systems allow one voyager per system to remain on standby while disconnected.
3 2
DAZ: When reengaged, the voyager continues from that exact position - allowing Nomai to quickly return to their voyages, no matter how far they traveled from the projection pool!
4 2
DAZ: I find your hypothesis highly compelling - the memory storage systems must be confused somehow to cause the telepathic link you described. However, it is not to do with the voyager stone itself..
5 4
DAZ: The problem seems to arise when multiple Nomai share the same projection pool, as you and Coleus likely did while working in shifts.
6 5
DAZ: It appears the voyager system currently fails to discern between the first voyager, and any subsequent Nomai voyaging from that projection pool to the same destination.
7 6
DAZ: Instead of creating a new voyager, they inhabit the inactive voyager - causing both memory storage systems to be connected to the same voyager, and creating a stream of shared consciousness!
8 7
OENO: Goodness, what an illuminating and expedient assessment, Daz! I suppose such a major issue should be fixed.. though I must admit it was fun sharing a consciousness with someone else!
9 8
OENO: But now that we know the issue, Coleus and I shall simply work from different projection pools until it is fixed - that should prevent the system from confusing our memory storage systems again!
